intro: Euphrasia frigida var. pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf lady's tears, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It features small, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of delicate, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent dark markings. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude conditions. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens or as a hardy ornamental plant.
